requirements.quoted_text: I. for 5 years from the date created or received, all records, whether prepared by or on behalf of Respondent, that tend to show any lack of compliance by Respondent with this Order; and
requirements.deadline: 5 years from date created or received

requirements.description: Retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each Provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: J. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each Provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through written requests for information and records, direct communications and interviews with Respondent's affiliates, and other lawful investigative means including undercover operations.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury) and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview; the interviewee may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers or suppliers, without identification or prior notice; nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 & 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed in federal court alleging a violation, whichever is later.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate 20

requirements.description: Order will terminate 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later; if such complaint is dismissed or ruled in Respondent's favor and not appealed or upheld on appeal, the Order terminates as though the complaint was never filed
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate 20 years from the date of its issuance (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission’s seal), or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than 20 years; B. this Order’s application to Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any Provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate 20 years from the date of its issuance (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission's seal), or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than 20 years; B. this Order's application to Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
